section.title: Introduction
section.p: Centipede divides build functionality up into units call "cents". See the indian penny up at the top of the page? You get it? Yeah I know.
A is essentially an identified library (or set of libraries) along with a xbuild.xml. These are located in tools/cents off of the main project directory.

Cents are distributed as jar files and unzipped in this directory as required. There are a number of cents available for you already and most of these are documented here; however, its very simple to create your own cent. It requires only a little knowledge of Ant and well some basic rudimentary competence.

To create a Cent merely create a directory such as myproject.cent. Create a xbuild.xml file such as /tools/cents/centipede.cent/xbuild.xml. Put in the tasks.properties file with the task to fire up. Then run build jar-cent.
